Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Bowl
Description: Lovely hemispherical bowl of a very simple shape. The lip has been thinned. The interior and the upper section of the exterior have been carefully polished, the lower exterior more crudely so. The clay is fine, common and orange. The bowl may have functioned as an oil lamp because the bottom and several sections of the lip still bear black patches.
